Besides the above frameworks for aggregating the IPCC’s three components individually, the vulnerability assessments have been also conducted by several modified frameworks that use various combinations of two of the IPCC’s three components. Based on the basic concept addressed in the IPCC TAR
1 , Metzger et al.
24 proposed another framework that uses the potential impact component by combining the exposure and sensitivity components. For assessing the relative vulnerability of communities to climate change impacts, Hahn et al.
25 developed a framework for the livelihood vulnerability index, where a function of the exposure and coping components is combined with the sensitivity component. In the MOVE (Method for the Improvement of Vulnerability in Europe) framework, the average of the sensitivity and coping components is combined with the exposure component as in Depietri et al.
26 On behalf of the three modified frameworks where the two components are combined to be compiled with the other component, the framework using the potential impact PI as a composite component of exposure and sensitivity is selected for one of the conventional frameworks for the vulnerability indicator.
